Browse the source code of netbsd/external/lgpl3/mpfr/dist/src/powerof2.c

1/* mpfr_powerof2_raw -- test whether a floating-point number is a power of 2
2

5

7

9it under the terms of the GNU Lesser General Public License as published by
10the Free Software Foundation; either version 3 of the License, or (at your
11option) any later version.
12
13The GNU MPFR Library is distributed in the hope that it will be useful, but
14WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of MERCHANTABILITY
15or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE. See the GNU Lesser General Public
16License for more details.
17
18You should have received a copy of the GNU Lesser General Public License
19along with the GNU MPFR Library; see the file COPYING.LESSER. If not, see
20http://www.gnu.org/licenses/ or write to the Free Software Foundation, Inc.,
2151 Franklin St, Fifth Floor, Boston, MA 02110-1301, USA. */
22
23#include "mpfr-impl.h"
24
25/* This is an internal function and one assumes that x is a non-special
26 * number (more precisely, only its significand is considered and this
27 * function can be used even if the exponent field of x has not been
28 * initialized). It returns 1 (true) if |x| is a power of 2, else 0.
29 */
30
31int
32mpfr_powerof2_raw (mpfr_srcptr x)
33{
34 /* This is an internal function, and we may call it with some
35 wrong numbers (ie good mantissa but wrong flags or exp)
36 So we don't want to test if it is a pure FP.
37 MPFR_ASSERTN(MPFR_IS_PURE_FP(x)); */
38 return mpfr_powerof2_raw2 (MPFR_MANT(x), MPFR_LIMB_SIZE(x));
39}
40
41int
42mpfr_powerof2_raw2 (const mp_limb_t *xp, mp_size_t xn)
43{
44 if (xp[--xn] != MPFR_LIMB_HIGHBIT)
45 return 0;
46 while (xn > 0)
47 if (xp[--xn] != 0)
48 return 0;
49 return 1;
50}
51
